intro: Amsinckia ctenocarpa, commonly known as the hooked leaf desert parsley, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along canyon walls. Its botanical features include a taproot system and hairy stems, which help it conserve moisture in harsh conditions. It is classified within the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
